title: Facebook has been in a struggle to break into hardware for at least 6 years
text: For the past six years, Facebook has tried over and over to release a hardware product that consumers will want, and it has never succeeded.

title: Facebook wants to put a camera in your TV
text: Facebook unveiled its newest Portal devices, its smart speaker with a screen. CNN Business sat down with Facebook VP Andrew "Boz" Bosworth to discuss data and privacy concerns.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to meet with policymakers about internet regulation
text: Zuckerberg has called for more government regulation.

title: Germany Joins France In Pushing Back Against Facebook's Libra
text: France and Germany have both agreed to block Facebook’s Libra cryptocurrency. German parliamentarian Thomas Heilmann said the German government will block projects like Libra, which aligns with France's stance.

title: Facebook to Copy Snap's Least Popular Offering
text: The social networking giant has smart augmented reality glasses in the works.

title: Mark Zuckerberg heads to Capitol Hill for first time since testifying about Cambridge Analytica
text: The Facebook CEO will talk to policymakers "about future internet regulation," according to a spokesperson.

title: Mark Zuckerberg to meet with lawmakers in D.C. on Thursday
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is going to Washington on Thursday -- his first visit to Capitol Hill since he testified before Congress last year.

title: Amid a privacy crisis, Facebook now wants to put a camera on your TV
text: When Facebook first introduced Portal, a smart speaker with a screen, in October of last year, the company was grappling with a seemingly endless list of privacy issues. The idea of Facebook -- that Facebook -- trying to sell consumers on putting its camera and microphone in their homes seemed tone deaf, to say the least.

title: How Facebook, Comcast Just Shook Up The Streaming Video Wars
text: Streaming video stocks came under pressure Wednesday, led by a double-digit percentage loss in shares of Roku Inc (NASDAQ: ROKU).

title: Facebook Announces More Portal Devices for Some Reason
text: Would you put Facebook cameras and microphones in your home?

title: AR News: Facebook, Ray-Ban Team Up on ‘Orion’ Smart Glasses
text:
AR news for Wednesday includes a possible partnership between Facebook (FB) and Ray-Ban for a pair of smart glasses that may replace phones.
The post AR News: Facebook, Ray-Ban Team Up on ‘Orion’ Smart Glasses appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Facebook Expands Streaming Wars, Takes A Bite Out Of Roku
text: Facebook has unveiled its video-streaming Portal TV and Comcast plans to offer its Xfinity Flex set-top box for free to internet customers. Roku stock dived while Facebook was flat.

title: Facebook's Bosworth on New Generation of Portal Devices
text: Facebook Inc. has unveiled a new generation of portal devices that have lower prices and the ability for users to opt-out of the company reviewing voice recordings collected by the hardware. Facebook's Vice President for Augmented and Virtual Reality Andrew Bosworth, who also oversees hardware at the company, speaks with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs.

title: Facebook's Portal TV Gives Roku Investors Pause
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is preparing to launch Portal TV, a clip-on camera accessory for video calling, AR gaming and content co-watching.

title: Facebook unveils new Portal video chat, TV streaming devices
text: Facebook Inc  unveiled new models of its Portal video chatting devices on Wednesday, making the company's first foray into TV streaming hardware but offering a limited selection of subscription services.

title: Facebook launches Portal TV, a $149 video chat set-top box
text: Facebook wants to take over your television with a clip-on camera for video calling, AR gaming, and content co-watching. If you can get past the creepiness, the new Portal TV let you hang out with friends on your home’s biggest screen.

title: Facebook takes another crack at smart home market with Portal TV, combining video chat and streaming
text: Facebook unveils the Portal TV, a streaming device that comes with a camera and microphones for making video calls via television.

title: Hands on with Facebook’s Portal TV
text: We try out Facebook’s new video chat TV set-top box and smaller smart screens

title: Facebook to launch new Portal smart displays in Europe
text: WhatsApp joins Messenger on camera-equipped photo frame-like device tied in with Alexa
